title: Weeknight Skillet Slaw Recipe
description: This colorful slaw made with ground turkey, fresh vegetables, and a savory sauce is perfect for a quick and hearty weeknight dinner.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Meat and Poultry Turkey Ground Turkey Recipes Weeknight Skillet Slaw 4.5 (161) 138 Reviews 27 Photos When you get home from work, you hardly want a big production for dinner. That's when this recipe can be your standby. Cook your ground turkey, then add veggies, cole slaw mix, and sauce and in 10 minutes you've got a hearty meal for everyone to enjoy. Submitted by Matt Wencl Updated on August 7, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 27 27 27 27 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 4 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 tablespoon chipotle hot sauce (such as Cholula®) 1 tablespoon rice vinegar 1 tablespoon soy sauce 1 ½ teaspoons minced ginger 1 teaspoon agave syrup 1 tablespoon olive oil 1 tablespoon sesame oil 1 pound ground turkey ½ teaspoon salt ½ tablespoon ground black pepper 1 (8 ounce) package coleslaw mix ½ red bell pepper, diced 2 green onions, chopped, or more to taste 2 cloves garlic, minced 1 tablespoon sesame seeds Directions Mix chipotle hot sauce, rice vinegar, soy sauce, ginger, and agave syrup together in a small bowl to make sauce. Heat olive oil and sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Add ground turkey; cook, stirring to break up clumps, until juices run clear, about 6 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl, reserving juices in the wok. Combine coleslaw mix, red bell pepper, green onions, and garlic in the wok; cook and stir over medium heat until slaw is slightly wilted, 1 to 2 minutes. Add sauce; mix to combine, about 1 minute. Return turkey to the wok and stir until heated through, 2 to 3 minutes. Sprinkle sesame seeds over slaw before serving. Cook’s Note Substitute ginger paste for the minced ginger and/or white sugar for the agave syrup if desired.Use coleslaw mix with red cabbage and carrots for maximum color and vegetable variety. I Made It Print 356 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Weeknight Skillet Slaw 01 of 27 Photo by  Buckwheat Queen 02 of 27 Photo by  Calligraphybytheresa 07/15/2021 03 of 27 Photo by  MaryAnn Ro Rowland 11/21/2020 04 of 27 Photo by  Deda1223 11/16/2020 Holy moly! This IS crack!!! I'm starting a healthy eating plan and this is #1 on my list!!! 05 of 27 Photo by  Lioness3307 07/19/2020 06 of 27 Photo by  Roseann Crist Dunteman 05/27/2020 Such a yummy, quick dinner. I substituted 1/3 tsp. chili paste for the hot sauce, and maple syrup for the agave syrup (based on what I had on hand). I added apx. 1/2 lb. asparagus spears cut on the diagonal with the veggies at the end. Earning its name, this was so good I ate the leftovers for breakfast the next morning! (I've also added sautéed mushrooms.). 07 of 27 Photo by  Roseann Crist Dunteman 05/27/2020 Such a yummy, quick dinner. I substituted 1/3 tsp. chili paste for the hot sauce, and maple syrup for the agave syrup (based on what I had on hand). I added apx. 1/2 lb. asparagus spears cut on the diagonal with the veggies at the end. Earning its name, this was so good I ate the leftovers for breakfast the next morning! (I've also added sautéed mushrooms.). 08 of 27 Photo by  passion8chef 05/23/2020 I love this simple yet tasteful dish. I substituted a couple of items according to what I had on hand: white wine vinegar for rice wine vinegar, 1 tsp white sugar for agave syrup, and yellow onion for the green onion. I also reduced the black pepper to 1/2 tsp. I used the entire 16-oz package of cole slaw mix. Will definitely make it again. 09 of 27 Photo by  heilau 05/05/2020 We used this as a side to fresh Arctic Char and Charmoula. Basically the sauce what what we used, and I appreciated braising the vegetables a bit rather than a raw cole slaw. I doubled the sauce and used several radishes, a half a cabbage, fresh Ramps, garlic, carrots and celery. It was delicious and a crunchy alternative to rice or carbs. 10 of 27 Photo by  heilau 05/05/2020 We used this as a side to fresh Arctic Char and Charmoula. Basically the sauce what what we used, and I appreciated braising the vegetables a bit rather than a raw cole slaw. I doubled the sauce and used several radishes, a half a cabbage, fresh Ramps, garlic, carrots and celery. It was delicious and a crunchy alternative to rice or carbs. 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Chinese Napa Cabbage Salad 391 Ratings Amazing Asian Chicken Salad 45 Ratings Asian Cabbage Salad 174 Ratings Red Cabbage and Celery Root Coleslaw with Apple Cider Dressing 7 Ratings Kim Chee Squats 11 Ratings Quick and Easy Kimchi Salad 11 Ratings Japanese-Style Cabbage Salad 71 Ratings Napa Cabbage Slaw with Carrots and Sesame 1 Rating Colorful Coleslaw 2 Ratings Sweet Sesame Slaw 84 Ratings Quick and Easy Thai Style Coleslaw 49 Ratings Cilantro-Lime Coleslaw 174 Ratings Ramen Coleslaw 651 Ratings Summer Cabbage Salad 10 Ratings Asian Coleslaw with Candied Walnuts 8 Ratings Lemony Cabbage-Avocado Slaw 10 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Matt Wencl
instructions: Mix chipotle hot sauce, rice vinegar, soy sauce, ginger, and agave syrup together in a small bowl to make sauce.;Heat olive oil and sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Add ground turkey; cook, stirring to break up clumps, until juices run clear, about 6 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl, reserving juices in the wok.;Combine coleslaw mix, red bell pepper, green onions, and garlic in the wok; cook and stir over medium heat until slaw is slightly wilted, 1 to 2 minutes. Add sauce; mix to combine, about 1 minute. Return turkey to the wok and stir until heated through, 2 to 3 minutes.;Sprinkle sesame seeds over slaw before serving.
